intro: Alsine rosanoi, commonly known as the Rosano's sandwort, is a low-growing annual plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants adapted to dry environments. The plant typically has small, fleshy leaves and produces clusters of tiny, white or pink flowers. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed or open habitats. Its botanical features reflect its adaptation to harsh, arid conditions, making it a resilient species in its native range.
